CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 13, 1956, pg. 4, reads: "Friends Give Flowers - For the Gold Star Mother, whose funeral was held from the West Funeral Home on Monday. Well-wishers holding them are, left to right, Mrs. L. M. Ruffin of Ebenezer Baptist Church, Mrs. Homer Watkins of the Ladies Auxiliary, Smith-Watkins Post 2; Mrs. Carrie Henderson and Mrs. Lula B. Irons. - Harris Photo."  Her obituary reads: "Harris, Lenore of 97 Crawford St. (lately of 144 Elm St.) died in Mercy Hospital, Aug. 24.  Services here held Tuesday from West Funeral Home, with the Rev. James B. Cayce officiating.  There were no immediate survivors."
TitMainTitle: Men loading casket into hearse, and women, including from left: Ella M. Ruffin, Mrs. Homer Watkins, Carrie Henderson, and Lula B. Irons holding flowers, for funeral of Gold Star mother Lenore Harris
